oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Po-Po Owie: or Fixing a Prolapsed Prepuce in Feedlot Steers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, Robert A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Preputial injuries
feedlot steers
prolapsed tissue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Preputial ("po po") injuries ("owies") in feedlot steers is not an everyday occurrence, but is commonly seen. They are most common in Brahman cross cattle. When exposed to the feedlot environment, the prolapsed tissue frequently enlarges, is traumatized and is subject to further injury, such as being stepped on.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1999; 177
